Dear Mr. Gloss:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
03/23/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4150 (4) I ncident reporting
(4) When a resident’s behavior results in contact with
law enforcement, the incident shall be reported to the
parent/legal guardian, responsible referring agency, and
the licensing authority as soon as possible, but not more
than 24 hours after the incident.
All seven incident reports reviewed that contained contact with law enforcement
did not also contain any contact with Licensing within 24 hours after the incident.
CCI Rule 400.4166 D ischarge plan
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional
care, all of the following information shall be
documented in the case record within 14 days after
discharge:
(e) A statement that the discharge plan
recommendations, including medical and dental
follow up that is needed, have been reviewed with
the resident and with the parent and with the
responsible case manager.
2

Two out of two closed files reviewed did not contain any confirmation that the
discharge plan recommendations were reviewed with the youth and their parent or
caregiver.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE

• No technical assistance was offered during this inspection.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was offered regarding collaboration with local law enforcement and
crisis mental health services within medical providers as well as communication
with families after discharge.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The inspection completed on 05/09/2022 contained one rule violation findings. A
corrective action plan was submitted and approved on 05/12/2022. Through
findings during this current inspection the facility has been found to now be in
compliance with this specific rule.
Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting and auditing for the facility was provided by the overseeing
organization and no concerns were noted. The facility was recently awarded a
large grant and plans on utilizing the funds to update the kitchen and backyard
areas of the facility.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Annual Assessment was received on 03/27/2023. The facility
assessed that the previous Corrective Action Plan from last year's inspection had
been able to be implemented and followed with success. The facility reported no
unplanned discharges during the reporting period. Central Registry documentation
process changes were discussed as well.
3

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were completed on 03/15/2023. Staff reported positive feedback
about working at the facility. Training ideas were discussed. Several staff stated to
the effect that they enjoy the smaller number of youth at a time and the ability to
connect well with the youth and provide support and aftercare services after their
discharge.
As of 03/15/2023 there was one youth that was placed at the facility but was unable
to be interviewed that day because he was at school. By the time efforts were
made to arrange an interview that youth had successfully discharged, and no other
youth were placed at the facility during the time of this inspection.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Facility walkthrough was completed on 03/15/2023 during an unannounced visit to
the facility. The building was in good repair and clean. New plans were discussed
for updated renovations to the facility kitchen and the backyard area, including
fencing and the basketball court.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
